metadata.dc:description: One case of abdominal lithokelyphopedion of 9 years permanece is presented. The case was diagnosed clinically and by ultrasound and successfully treated by surgery. We comment the conditions and modifying factors that may play a role in the development of a lithokelyphopedion and discuss the clinico-pathological correlation.

[Lithokelyphopedion: presentation of a case of 9 years of clinical course].
